item.title: Compiler explorer
item.description: This is a great tool. (https://godbolt.org/). Time has come to learn some assembly.

item.title: MIT on decentralization
item.description: MIT paper on defending internet freedom through decentralization: http://dci.mit.edu/assets/papers/decentralized_web.pdf

item.title: OpenAI
item.description: OpenAI’s article on evolution strategies algorithm as a scalable alternative to reinforcement learning. For unsupervised learning, the gradients can be computed with finite differences instead of backpropagation. Apparently, using this algorithm in tensorflow which works with denormal numbers off, nonlinearity arises from deep linear networks.

item.title: Self-driving cars
item.description: Machine learning for self-driving Euro Truck Simulator 2 https://github.com/marshq/europilot. I played ETS2 about 10 years ago and dammit, this drives better.

item.title: Towers of Hanoi and their visualization as the Sierpi≈Ñski triangle
Game of life on a torus
item.description: The game of life on a torus https://github.com/Bauxitedev/goltorus

item.title: Prime numbers
item.description: This is my sieve of Eratosthenes. Well, it's not mine and Eratosthenes' at the same time. It rather belongs to Eratosthenes more, since he thought of it first. I guess I just like it so much that subconsciously I claimed his idea. And how fast is it? Hmmm .numbers li{ display: inline-block; counter-increment: numbers; color: grey; text-align:center; padding: 0.5vw; width: 30px; height: 30px; line-height: 30px; color: red; } .numbers li::before{ content: counter(numbers); } .
